pull.title: doc: getaddressinfo[isscript] is optional
pull.body:
`isscript` is unknown for unknown witness versions, so it should be marked optional in the docs

Fixes https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/30456

events.body:

code LGTM fa63ecc72045ffa771448941e1fe066f7421f640 but I think the [test needs to be fixed](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30457#discussion_r1679837166)

Approach ACK
Thanks for increasing clarity in RPC.
Looks like there's a missing `assert` in `test_getaddressinfo()`.
Left a nit.

verification.payload:
tree f836690f7ce3fc6def602f63bbb5010e2ae75da1
parent 45750f61d65d5ac4a28333d8f676961037b25f55
author MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1721150582 +0200
committer MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1721191918 +0200

doc: getaddressinfo[isscript] is optional

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -109,6 +111,7 @@ def test_getaddressinfo(self):
         assert_raises_rpc_error(-5, "Invalid or unsupported Segwit (Bech32) or Base58 encoding.", node.getaddressinfo, BECH32_INVALID_PREFIX)
         assert_raises_rpc_error(-5, "Invalid or unsupported Base58-encoded address.", node.getaddressinfo, BASE58_INVALID_PREFIX)
         assert_raises_rpc_error(-5, "Invalid or unsupported Segwit (Bech32) or Base58 encoding.", node.getaddressinfo, INVALID_ADDRESS)
+        "isscript" not in node.getaddressinfo(BECH32_VALID_UNKNOWN_WITNESS)
comments.body:
This is a no-op, I think you meant to assert?
```suggestion
        assert "isscript" not in node.getaddressinfo(BECH32_VALID_UNKNOWN_WITNESS)
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -534,7 +534,7 @@ RPCHelpMan getaddressinfo()
                         {RPCResult::Type::BOOL, "solvable", "If we know how to spend coins sent to this address, ignoring the possible lack of private keys."},
                         {RPCResult::Type::STR, "desc", /*optional=*/true, "A descriptor for spending coins sent to this address (only when solvable)."},
                         {RPCResult::Type::STR, "parent_desc", /*optional=*/true, "The descriptor used to derive this address if this is a descriptor wallet"},
-                        {RPCResult::Type::BOOL, "isscript", "If the key is a script."},
+                        {RPCResult::Type::BOOL, "isscript", /*optional=*/true, "If the key is a script."},
comments.body: unrelated: that is _quite_ the field description 😳 Time to start thinking about deprecating `isscript` and `iswitness`, perhaps?

Maybe it's worth adding a line for segwit v0 as well?  (e.g. witness program not 20 or 32 bytes long)?

also

nit:  might increase clarity
```diff
- BECH32_VALID_UNKNOWN_WITNESS = 'bcrt1p424qxxyd0r'
+ BECH32_VALID_UNKNOWN_WITNESS_PROG = 'bcrt1p424qxxyd0r'
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -109,6 +111,7 @@ def test_getaddressinfo(self):
         assert_raises_rpc_error(-5, "Invalid or unsupported Segwit (Bech32) or Base58 encoding.", node.getaddressinfo, BECH32_INVALID_PREFIX)
         assert_raises_rpc_error(-5, "Invalid or unsupported Base58-encoded address.", node.getaddressinfo, BASE58_INVALID_PREFIX)
         assert_raises_rpc_error(-5, "Invalid or unsupported Segwit (Bech32) or Base58 encoding.", node.getaddressinfo, INVALID_ADDRESS)
+        "isscript" not in node.getaddressinfo(BECH32_VALID_UNKNOWN_WITNESS)

@@ -534,7 +534,7 @@ RPCHelpMan getaddressinfo()
                         {RPCResult::Type::BOOL, "solvable", "If we know how to spend coins sent to this address, ignoring the possible lack of private keys."},
                         {RPCResult::Type::STR, "desc", /*optional=*/true, "A descriptor for spending coins sent to this address (only when solvable)."},
                         {RPCResult::Type::STR, "parent_desc", /*optional=*/true, "The descriptor used to derive this address if this is a descriptor wallet"},
-                        {RPCResult::Type::BOOL, "isscript", "If the key is a script."},
+                        {RPCResult::Type::BOOL, "isscript", /*optional=*/true, "If the key is a script."},
comments.body: yeah I was having a real hard time understanding what a lot of these fields actually mean...

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -534,7 +534,7 @@ RPCHelpMan getaddressinfo()
                         {RPCResult::Type::BOOL, "solvable", "If we know how to spend coins sent to this address, ignoring the possible lack of private keys."},
                         {RPCResult::Type::STR, "desc", /*optional=*/true, "A descriptor for spending coins sent to this address (only when solvable)."},
                         {RPCResult::Type::STR, "parent_desc", /*optional=*/true, "The descriptor used to derive this address if this is a descriptor wallet"},
-                        {RPCResult::Type::BOOL, "isscript", "If the key is a script."},
+                        {RPCResult::Type::BOOL, "isscript", /*optional=*/true, "If the key is a script."},
comments.body:
I think it means "some kind of pay to script hash", that is SH or WSH.

I guess it would be clearer to just return an enum as string, rather than a collection of boolean fields.
